dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single daisy stands in a vase in an empty kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER FIELDS clicks on the light to the closet. He looks the rack of his parents' clothes. He begins to put some in a box marked "home", some in a b marked "thrift".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver enters the bathroom and flushes bottle after bottl pills and liquids down the toilet. Next he struggles as h looks over the old toothbrush, hairbrush, all the bottles tubes besides the sink. He stares for a beat, then throws them all away.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HAL'S TRASH AREA
dialogues.text: Oliver hauls trash outside, adding it to a very large pil bags. An older Jack Russell Terrier, ARTHUR, follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur sit on the office floor surrounded by papers, boxes, books and trash bags. He finds a photo of FIELDS in an open Jean jacket, no shirt, it's attached to personal ad application which he begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LARGE EMPTY PARKING LOT NIGHT
dialogues.text: In the dark, OLIVER FIELDS has a tape recorder and microphone, he follows ANDY as he excitedly prepares, a g of friends looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Is it on? (recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for our friend Hal Fields. Hal. We love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy quickly lights a rack of large fireworks, they shoot into the night and explode - smoke - more explosions - everyone's laughing. Oliver looks up at the fireworks, recording the sounds, happy. BOOM, BOOM, BOOM, BOOM, BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver has packed his car, he leans down to Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming to live with me now. Arthur looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my car. Arthur hops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's car drives down Sunset boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur enter, he's carrying a box, his house i dark and lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver enters his dining room, Arthur in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the dining room where people come and eat sometimes. The dog listens intently. Oliver moves on, the dog follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur enter the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks around, the dog looks with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the door open revealing Oliver and Arthur continui their tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the bathroom. The dog looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur lays next to Oliver in bed. Unable to sleep, Olive looks to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is 2003. This is what the sun looks like, and the stars, nature. This is the President.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER V.O.
dialogues.text: And this is the sun in 1955, and the stars, and nature, and cars, and phones, and movies, and the President. These are what pets looked like. These are fireworks. This was smoking.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is what it looked like when people kissed...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...When they were happy...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...When they were sad.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My parents got married in 1955.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a museum director - she fixed up old houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had a child, and they stayed married for 44 years...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...Until she died in their bed, after four months of cancer and eating French toast for every meal and watching the Teletubbies everyday and confusing white straws for her cigarettes and skipping back and forth through time inside her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal fields sits on a couch, in a purple sweater, looking camera, struggling for words.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Six months later, my father told me he was gay. He had just turned 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gay. Same camera angle, Hal still looking into camera we jump to him wearing a robe.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I always remember him wearing a purple sweater when he told me this but actually he wore a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gay. Same angle, we continue to jump cut through Hal talking t camera, each cut in different clothes, and with each cut line has a different inflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gay. Jump cut, new outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved your mother, but, uh... now I want to explore this side. Jump cut, new outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be just theoretically gay, I want to do something about it. New outfit and inflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I want to do something about it... New outfit and inflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I want to do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. VARIOUS
dialogues.text: A live action "portrait" of Hal, looking into camera, fir in old clothes, then jump cut to new all black outfit.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He changed all his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves through a large group of men and streame gathered for Los Angeles Pride event.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He got a boyfriend, Andy, a physical trainer who was also studying for his professional pyrotechnic license. Camera lands on Hal beaming with pride, his arm around An who looks into camera and says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I came out to my father, he never speaks to me. That's why I've been always attracted to older men. Hal and friends laugh warmly at Andy. We cut to live acti "portraits" of a priest, a therapist, the Primetimers, hi movie-night club, and the large L.A. Pride group, all loo into camera. OLIVER V.O. He found an out gay priest to guide him spiritually. He saw a therapist for the first time. He joined the Primetimers. Movie night. Los Angeles Pride, and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Hal's living room, empty of furniture in the morni light. OLIVER V.O. Four years after he came out, he died in this room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver enters, followed closely by Arthur. Oliver walks through the kitchen - Arthur follows him. Oliver walks through the living room - Arthur follows. Oliver makes a circle through the house - Arthur follows. Oliver sits, looking down at Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, its lonely out here, so you'd better learn how to talk with me. Arthur's face looks up at him filled with a dog's love an words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I understand up to 150 words - I don't talk. Oliver leans down, pushing his head into Arthur's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera follow's Oliver down a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver sits as HAL lays in a coma on a ventilator. The ro is dark, Oliver uses a flashlight to quietly read to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS. A nurse opens the shades. A DOCTOR and two nu stand over Hal, everyone's nervous. Hal is struggling wit all the tubes down his throat. Oliver is trying to help h breathe, talking into his ear. Oliver is ushered out of the room. The nurse draws the curtain. MOMENTS LATER: Oliver sits with Hal, now off the ventilat but still very weak and disoriented. Oliver coaches his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm. Calm, calm breaths. Hal coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the night, Hal is connected to many I. in both arms, still disoriented, he's tangled up in the tubes, trying to pull them out of his arms. He wakes up Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver! Please help me with all these ropes. Oliver rushes and helps him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, Pop, stop -- you're gonna hurt yourself. A NURSE quickly enters and helps hold down his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fields, we're going to have to secure your arms again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts his hands in restraints, Oliver helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? She's great. The nurse smiles, embarrassed, and continues with her job

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a great nurse in the hospital, we don't really know her, you're very high on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always have some very good reason, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Pop, I just don't want to be like you and mom. (aside to the nurse) Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE KITCHEN: We see 10-year-old Oliver watching his mo GEORGIA and father kiss quickly, politely, and then his father leaves quickly. Hal remains in silhouette through shot. DIFFERENT DAY, IN OLIVER'S BEDROOM: Oliver watches Hal an Georgia kiss, and Hal leave - more like a performance tha anything real. DIFFERENT DAY, IN PARENT'S BEDROOM: Oliver watches Hal an Georgia kiss and Hal exit, quick and dry. 10-year-old Oliver studies them each time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIFFERENT DAY, OLIVER'S BEDROOM: Georgia quickly opens th door and finds Oliver drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver! He turns and Georgia shoots him with her finger, Oliver f to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olly, you can do better. He gets up and she shoots him again - He falls more dramatically, knocking his head on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. His mom looks at him affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver walks Arthur across a lit field, towards the dog p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere dogs and their people are playing. Oliver and Arthur sit on a bench like two humans. Oliver watches the action, Arthur stares at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go have your own experiences with your own people. I'll be right here... Arthur stays by Oliver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a human. I'm not a dog. And you're a Jack Russell, that's a breed. Your personality was created by this guy John Russell, a hunting enthusiast, in the 1800s. And he bred your ancestors to have stamina and courage for the hunt. You think you're just you, and you want to chase the foxes, but other people planted that in you years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, somewhat arbitrarily, you are considered very cute by us humans, and we keep breeding you not to chase foxes, but to be cute, and we put you in movies and television shows, and you, you're chasing tennis balls cause there as close to a fox as you're going to get. Arthur stays by Oliver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on Oliver's hands as he draws a T-shirt that reads: "My personality was created by someone else and all I got this stupid T-shirt." Reveal that Oliver is in a design office. LIZ, 30's enter they IMPROV hellos. JUMP CUT thru a series of Oliver's drawings. A speech bub that reads: "A fair amount of failures." He draws portrai of girls with dates: "Ellen O. 1984-1988" -- "Julie P. 19 1989" -- "Liz B. 1993 - 1995" -- "Lynette I. 1995" -- "Amanda Y. 1996-2000" -- "Yuki H. 2000" -- "Christina S. 2001" -- "Michelle M. 2001-2003" Oliver stops drawing, lost in his thoughts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark I.C.U. room, Hal is still attached to many I. Oliver is helping Hal look at a book of Japanese rock gar with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to read this? I found it in your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright. Give me the flashlight. Oliver opens it, they look at a few pages together, photo serene gardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal keeps peeking at a bouquet of flowers in the corner o the room. Hal takes the flashlight from Oliver and guides to the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Andy brought those for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Hal continues to direct the light across the room, we fol the circle of light as it moves a cross a wall landing on painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, who did that painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know. Its just a painting on the wall. Hal continues exploring, Oliver's enjoying his father's curiosity, he lands on some photos displayed on the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A--, and these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just photos, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do they relate to the exhibit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just personal photos. They're not art. Hal slowly moves the flashlight up the wall, across the ceiling to a strange assortment of fire detectors, sprinklers, sensors, all laid out against the acoustic ti ceiling. Hal points up. Oliver looks for a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well that's the water sprinkler thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, its beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Putting the Japanese gardens there. It's just beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks from the ceiling to the rock garden book. Th ceiling and the gardens look the same. Oliver is moved by Hal's confusion. ANDY, 45-years-old, physical, boyish, st into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy! Andy gets on the bed opposite Oliver. He gives Hal a big on the lips. Hal glows. Oliver backs away slowly. Andy pi up Hal's hand, turns it palm up and presses his face into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought something for you. Oliver watches from outside the room as Andy excitedly pu a portable tape player out of his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made a recording for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Andy pushes play, on the recording we hear Andy's voice:

dialogues.speaker: ANDY ON TAPE
dialogues.text: This is for our friend Hal Fields. Hal. We love you. We hear voices HOOTING, and then large FIREWORKS, LAUGHTE and CLAPPING. Oliver watches his father's happiness from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on Oliver's hands drawing bright streaming colors of t fireworks. LATER: Oliver get's to his real work, pulling out a few 8 photos of a band "The Sads". There are some instructions record company letterhead - he is to do an album design f their new record - they want him to draw portraits of the three members. Oliver begins to do quick portraits of them based on the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Liz. Another band that wants portraits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least it pays the rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do something decent once, and that's all people ever want. JUMP CUT through the different portraits developing. It's what Oliver want's to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott and Shauna let themselves in. Elliot grabs a stoo and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Liz. Oliver continues to draw, as Shauna and Elliott try to ge his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pen is not your friend. The paper is not your friend. The party is your friend. We're your friends. Your friends are your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot is now dressed as a cop and Shauna as a large chic they are dancing with no music as Oliver sits on a couch depressed dressed as Sigmund Freud, complete with wig-bea glasses-pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the skills... he's got the moves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the moves... you've got the skills... 10/29/07 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver, Elliott, and Shauna are leaving. Arthur can't bel he's being left behind. It's actually the first time they will separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, you haven't been invited to this party. You're gonna stay and look after the house. Oliver tentatively shuts the door, takes three steps, Art begins to howl. Oliver tries to ignore it, but stops agai He looks back at the house and the howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, victorious, sits in Elliot's lap in the front sea while Oliver drives and Shauna is squeezed in back in her chicken outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember when Oliver was funny? And he could actually, like, talk, in complete sentences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny? Funny? I don't think so Fun maybe, but not funny unless, like, serious is funny. Then he's' fucking hilarious. Elliot and Oliver laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, lovable. You are very lovable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, very lovable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver carries Arthur, they all enter a costume party, ma their way through the crowd of people in all kinds of disguises, music blaring, Oliver slides into the less populated kitchen. A woman rushes up to Oliver, surprised see he has a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cute, does he do tricks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Arthur - he doesn't do tricks. In the background are a couple dressed as JULIAN and ETHE ROSENBERG, we see them observe Oliver and Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Arthur, SIT! Arthur promptly sits down. Oliver's totally surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so cute. Shake! Arthur sticks out his paw. Oliver doesn't like seeing Art blindly perform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, he's so cute, I want him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Freud accent) Does it make you feel powerful to order my dog around? Maybe give you a sense of power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're being a therapist! Freud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, yeah. Very good. Oliver picks up Arthur and escapes the kitchen. The Rosenberg's are still watching. LATER... Oliver and Arthur sit in a chair next to a couch where a dressed as a witch, complete with green face and long bla hair, is lying back as if in a traditional analysis sessi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't ask for this. Who would ask for this? This color. This nose. This cheek, this chin. You know, this is my life. This isn't a story. This isn't a joke... Oliver is playing along, but he's really not emotionally ready for this party. He feels very far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you came, Doc. Just really good to get this stuff off my chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Freud accent) I'm sorry. Our time is up, uh... for this week. Thank you for coming in. The witch moves on. Oliver sits with Arthur in his lap, alone, lost in all th joviality. We see that the woman dressed as Julius Rosenberg is watc him. Just as Oliver is about to get up, she plops herself down onto the couch, ready for her session. OLIVER V.O. Oh, I was just- I was gonna take a break, actually. She pulls out a writing pad, oblivious. Oliver can tell s not going to give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back in accent) Well, I guess we should start with your mother. The woman writes on her notepad and shows it to Oliver: "Never had one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then your father. She mimes shooting herself in the head and dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. You can't talk? Is it a mental problem? Do you need analysis? She writes on her pad: "I have laryngitis"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a physical problem. She smiles at him, looks at him a little too long, Oliver more and more pulled in by her playfulness - she writes: "Why are you at a party if you're sad?" CU on Oliver, surprised and impressed by her observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing such a good job of hiding it. How could you tell? Ethel holds up her notebook. She has drawn TWO EYES. Oliver's taken by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, I'm gonna need a drink. You? She smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, stay here, yeah? Oliver moves to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot and Shauna are deeply engaged in conversation with someone dressed as a pickle and someone dressed as much l colorful chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, its just not a natural color for a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning to Shauna's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look, you see what happens when you free yourself from the cage, walk away from the factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just have no real color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver slips past, hands Arthur to Elliot. He scoops ice from the bucket and starts filling two cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, one. Uh-oh, two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that me--, one, two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's two, two people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people. A girl and a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, wow, making moves. Oliver leaves Arthur in Elliott's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch him OK? Oliver begins to leave his drinks. We see his POV of the woman dressed as Julius Rosenberg waiting on the couch. Oliver slips into one of his memories...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT: The phone RINGS, wakes up Oliver, he turns on t light, answers the phone. PRE-CANCER Hal talks excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sorry I woke you! I went to Akbar tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal and his friends, BRIAN and ROBERT, make their way thr a crowded gay club. Hal is by far the oldest, and most excited, man there.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They had wonderfully loud music. In- sit, in-sit, in-sit. What kind of music is that?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Probably house music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal gets a pad and pen to write this down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "House music."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of Young Gay guys dance. Hal is on the side, danc by himself, hands in the air twinkling his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So did you meet anyone? At the packed bar, Hal drinks alone.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Young gay men don't go for older gay men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Oliver in bed, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver snaps out of his memory. He makes his way through crowd and delivers the drink to her. He looks at her a li too intensely, then blurts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to dance? She happily nods yes. They walk to the dance floor, we th Oliver's going to be shy, but he breaks into a kinetic, angular, dance. She's surprised with us - she laughs, the have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT THROUGH THE NIGHT: Oliver, "Julius", Elliott and Shauna are talking to a magician. "Julius" picks a card, magician mixes it into the full deck, pops a card into th air, it is hers. Shauna and Elliott can see that Oliver's coming alive. LATER. They dance again, now they're sweaty, the dance floor's packed - it's the pinnacle of the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's winnowing down in the background - "Julius" a Oliver look at each other in the mirror for a beat, and t simultaneously take their wigs off, revealing their true selves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Shes mouths a silent "hi"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you my number? She pulls out her pad and pen and hands them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. As he writes, Oliver spies Arthur sitting in the corner o the bathroom, staring directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her the darkness is about to drown us unless something drastic happens right now. Oliver looks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad dragging Arthur to the party. I should get home. It was really nice meeting you. She writes on her pad: "Au Revoir"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Au revoir. Yeah. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur walk up the empty street - Oliver kicki himself for missing his chance with her. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? ON THE OTHER END: Silence. A little breathing, the party background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you? BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beep means yes? BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to have a phone call with someone who doesn't talk... BEEEEEEEEEEEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm parked just right up the street. BEEP. They hang up. Oliver is filled with hope. CUT TO: "Julius" walking out into a pool of street light. They smile at each other, but don't say anything. They ge into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You point - I'll drive. Oliver starts the engine. She points forward and they hea off. At the light she points left, he follows. Down the street she points right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Oliver drives up on the sidewalk before the street, heads down it for half a block, then takes her ri We can hear them laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver, Arthur and the woman enter a very fancy hotel lob Oliver is impressed. She mime's giving him a tour but sti doesn't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and the woman open the door and enter her suite. T look at each other nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place. They sit on her bed. She steals his pipe, put's it in her mouth -- writes on her pad and shows it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my mother. My mother died five years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a hoarse whisper) Oh merd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you spoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not supposed to. She writes and present him with a new question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father died two months ago, almost three. She looks at him with sincere empathy and surprise. Olive opened up, an now everything gushes out, he barely knows he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, he was gay. She's very surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was gay the whole time they were married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came out after my mother died and, uh... he was 75 years old. There's a quiet moment of deep connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She mouths "No" (don't say sorry). She reaches out and ge runs a finger across Oliver's brow and the outline of his face, he's so vulnerable, she lovingly/mischievously squi his face together and messes up his hair. Then she leans and they kiss for the first time - delicately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. They lay down, she takes his arm and pulls him into spoon her. He pulls the covers over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver wakes, still in his clothes. ANNA is already up. S waves and Oliver smiles. Anna holds up her notebook: "Who are you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver. She writes again: "Go to NY. Audition. Back Thursday."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are you here when you get back? Anna holds up one finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year? Anna shakes her head and smiles. She gestures smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A month? Right. And then?... She pantomimes a camera rolling, and herself acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're filming here. Acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver smiles as he interprets her gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after?... She makes a casual tossing motion with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just somewhere else. Where? Anna only shrugs. She writes more, and tosses the notepad his lap. Oliver reads: "Can I see you again?" He's very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the long hallway, Oliver carries her bags, Anna holds onto Arthur's leash. Oliver reaches out and ho her hand. They stop and kiss - gentle and comfortable wit each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver now alone with Arthur - heading home, he's happy. CU on his face as he remembers... REPEAT SCENE: Oliver and Anna's first kiss, tentative and delicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's POV: Hal and Andy kiss lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's POV: Andy comes up behind Hal doing the dishes, kisses him. Hal smiles very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's POV: Andy kisses Hal in the Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OLIVER HOUSE ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur enter his home, much more alive than th last time we saw him come through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello house, (Low voice) hello Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver makes two piles of mail, one says Oliver Fields, o has a yellow forwarding sticker that says Hal Fields. The Fields pile is much bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Pop, you get so much mail. Oliver slows and stares at his father's magazine - The Advocate. Two attractive, shirtless men on the cover unde the title: America's Sweethearts. Oliver's lost in memory

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LONG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hal, its remarkable how well you've recovered from being on the ventilator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sit's on top of his hospital bed, wearing one of his black outfits, looking much healthier. A doctor sits on h bed, Oliver listens from the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bronchoscopy revealed a mass about the size of a quarter. It is located in your lower right lung. CU on Hal taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid the biopsy showed it's cancerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to have spread... to the large hilar lymph nodes in your chest and liver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR LONG (cont'd) With the already weakened state of your heart and lungs... As Dr. Long talks about treatments, Oliver drifts back fr the conversation, slowly retreating to a window in the fa corner, as we continue to hear Dr. Long speak, we see Oliver's thoughts, fixating on "a mass about the size of

dialogues.speaker: DR. LONG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ... Surgery isn't possible given its location. We can start radiation treatments and see if you're strong enough for Chemo. You will be able to go home.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF 25 PENNIES.
dialogues.text: We cut back to Hal's face, stoically digesting the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you. As the doctor leaves. Oliver takes his father's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's not rush out and tell everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to get him up a tree. Hal takes a moment and composes himself. In his eyes we c see that he knows there is an end to his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you read me something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal hands Oliver his Advocate magazine, he begins to read from "Tough Guys Do Dance."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brazilian ballet star is already known not only as a skilled partner, but also as a gifted and versatile dancer, who adeptly fields roles ranging... Camera tracks out of the room, leaving the two men alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF CU JUMP CUTS: We see Oliver's hands as he draws series of silhouetted figures hanging from trees, others happily beheaded, all with talking bubbles that say, "Let not rush out and tell everyone" JUMP CUTS: Oliver draws another severed head, then a woma smoking next to the words, "First lung cancer." JUMP TO LATER: Oliver tacks his drawings to the wall, loo at them. He looks down and pets Arthur, as we hear...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER V.O.
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's fine. He sleeps on your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But is he eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sits on his bed fully dressed, Oliver is visiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, he's eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I worry so much about-- As Andy enters, his hands mysteriously cupped together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh here we are... Andy shows Hal his cupped hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Andy, you can't bring that kind of thing in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I can look. Andy flashes open his hands, revealing nothing. He snorts laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Oliver watches with amusement. NURSE SOPHIA enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for inspection... The nurse works her way between Andy and Hal to take his pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Andy feels interrupted, strangely hurt by the nurse. The nurse begins to take Hal's vital signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Andy. Hal's boyfriend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sophia. Andy gets more and more upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I have the right to be here as much as anyone else. Hal lovingly cuts him off, trying to ease the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go take a walk. Calm yourself. Andy walks out, feeling embarrassed and rejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Andy hasn't had it easy. Be nice to him. To everyone's surprise, Andy storms back in with a bouque flowers, dumps them on Hal's chest, kisses him triumphant and leaves again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowing he stole them) Andy, where did you get these?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: JUMP CUTS: Oliver helps a group of Hal's gay friends and get settled. They're jovial, they come with drinks and flowers, the room gets very full. Oliver hands out cups, offers wine, Andy lifts his paper cup and makes a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, guys, this is to us. Cheers. A NURSE suddenly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinking's not allowed in the room. All the guys freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's not? She shakes her head no, the party stops, she leaves. Oliv instinctively polite, starts packing up their cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Moans and complaints from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. She's a wonderful nurse. (he pauses a beat, then raises his cup again) Here's to health care. Hal swigs back his wine. They all laugh, grab their cups toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To health care! Hal looks happy, Oliver smiles but can't believe his dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with my father? He was so polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I invited him - but he never returns my calls. The guys drink merrily. Someone shoves a cup into Oliver' hand, pours him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver, Elliott and Arthur are shopping in a very old and crowded used book store. Oliver picks up a stack of magaz as Elliott interrogates him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two, four, six, eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? That's all you're gonna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna meet her at her hotel again. You happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm very happy. Are you happy? Oliver drops his books on the counter to check out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to shop owner) Here's eight... Turns to Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't actually had a conversation yet, so, you know...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREETS NIGHT
dialogues.text: The three are now in Oliver's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking about her all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know that because?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're not talking about it. I know you. There's a pause, then the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. It's embarrassing. I'm 38 and falling for a girl again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia works at her writing table. Young Oliver, bored, watches her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER V.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's like I lost the instructions or I, I never had them... Young Oliver walks up to Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong with you guys? Georgia is startled, she hides her feelings with humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you, in the FBI?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KGB? (Oliver shakes his head, no) SLA? (no) PTA? (no) BMW? Oliver sits silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing wrong with me and Pop. Georgia's mask breaks revealing sadness. Oliver can see i she can see he sees it. Georgia gets up and leads Oliver of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand in front of his bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you feel bad, you go into a room and scream - loud as you want, for a minute or two, then it's out of you. It's called catharsis. She opens the door, pushes him inside, and closes the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Oliver pauses, confused in his room. He doesn't scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes back out. Sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like screaming... Georgia, never ruffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur watch from the car as Elliott gets a ca spray paint, heads to a blank wall across the street and sprays a large tag on a wall. He then runs back to the ca looks proudly at his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-E-IT, Elliot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! (Getting his criticism more) You're not very supportive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, its just copying something someone did, like, 30 years ago in the Bronx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah. I'm part of a tradition of civil disobedience, something bigger than myself. Oliver can't believe Elliott said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliott drives along-side Oliver who's walking with a spr paint can, terrified as he's never done this before. He tries to spray, nothing comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake it, you have to shake it. Oliver shakes it awkwardly, then sprays across the wall:

dialogues.speaker: BUSH FINDS JESUS
dialogues.text: Oliver runs back to the car, exhilarated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Historical consciousness... you know, something bigger than myself. Elliott scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it again. Elliott drives off. Oliver's coming to life.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIOTT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, but when you see her, don't tell her that you painted historical consciousness on the wall... WE SEE: more of Oliver's graffiti on different buildings:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OLIVER'S HOUSE DAY
dialogues.text: Oliver exits his house alone, down his front stairs to th street. Halfway down, he hears now familiar sound of Arth barking and howling. Oliver can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is sitting on the bed, gently petting Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sweet. He misses your Dad. She stops. Gets up, nervous, and walks past Oliver into t next room. Oliver follows her in. They pause uncomfortabl Anna suddenly leans in and kisses him. Before it goes to far...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we, we could, um, just talk for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. They awkwardly break apart. Anna goes to a chair, Oliver follows. While nothing has really been expressed between two, Anna seems to understand the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my name is Anna. You're worried you can't trust me because you don't know who I am. I get it. That makes sense to me. She falters, looks at him vulnerably. Oliver abruptly kis her. She pushes back. They pause. She traces his brow slo with her index finger, the way she did their first night.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO POST SEX
dialogues.text: The music carries us, they lie in bed, naked. Anna innoce leans over and takes Oliver's arm and bites down hard. He grimaces. She stops and kisses it, admiring her teeth mar She gets up, sits at a side table and finds her cigarette Oliver watches her. The music seems to bend and slow down, this continues as fall into memory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU on young Oliver's hand pushing on a record making the bending, slowing sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver, stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stands up bored, Georgia's in the connecting bathr getting ready to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This music's old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's black, black music is the deepest cause they suffered the most, them and the Jews. Oliver plops down on the bed, listening to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my next life I'm gonna marry a good hot blooded Jew - someone full of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jewish right? Georgia comes and sits with him, caresses his hair as she talks with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a quarter, I'm a half, your father's none. He has the least emotions, You'll have more emotions than him, but I'll have the most emotions. She likes that she has the most emotions. They head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get to play chauffeur but just to the bottom of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 year old Oliver's in the driving sear, Georgia smokes admires his handling of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're turning into a wonderful driver. Oliver's proud.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LACMA ART MUSEUM STEPS DAY
dialogues.text: Oliver escorts Georgia up the large steps of the museum. crowd from an opening gathers at the top.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DAVID SMITH GALLERY LACMA DAY
dialogues.text: Georgia and Oliver approach a David Smith sculpture. Afte staring at it's angels for a beat, Georgia begins to do a angular modern-dance-pantomime of the sculpture, imitatin it's shapes with her body. Oliver locks up with embarrassment. A confused and concerned museum guard approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me Mrs. Fields....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're not allowed to interact with the art?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Still embarrassed, Oliver takes Georgia's hand and walks away from the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too? You like being a good citizen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's sits in her kimono. Oliver's buttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you toss me my camisole. Oliver throws a sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my camisole. She throws the sweater back at him. Oliver looks around helplessly. He grabs a flower out of a vase and hands it her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camisole? Anna laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what a camisole is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was brought up by these animals and they didn't like questions. They're both smiling now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were very frowned upon. So I had to guess. Anna takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can ask me anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything? CUT TO: Oliver and Anna at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's out there? She points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another building like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in the building like us. Half of them think things will never work out. The other half believe in magic. It's like a war between them. Oliver smiles. He moves away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know so much about people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, you have to learn how to read their faces. She climbs onto his lap, straddles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For example... here is mad. Anna passes her hand across her face, and she's "mad".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy... Her hand passes again and she's "happy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes its just nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? She points at her blank face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing... And they are good at looking one way and being another way. Her playfulness is very meaningful to Oliver, he's in lov 10/29/07 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through a caged-in freeway overpass - Oliver is carrying Arthur while blindfolding Anna with his hands. O this we hear the sounds of the quiet hotel room and an intimate conversation between them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You don't know me. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, you have blonde hair that goes down to about here. You smoke in non-smoking rooms. Oliver is still covering her eyes, leading her to a certa point, the busy sound of the freeway fading up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, open your eyes... HIGH ANGLE on huge trucks and traffic racing just beneath Oliver and Anna's feet under the overpass. The trucks lay their horns as they pass, scaring and thrilling them. MOMENTS LATER: they walk alongside the LA river together, in arm, happy. The intimate conversation continues in voi over.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? You drive on the sidewalk. You were raised by animals. Sometimes you look very alone, like you just got here. They meet up with friends on the banks of the river.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, you see, you don't know me at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur are leaving, walking down the long hall together. Arthur seems to stop and look up at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's unlike any girl I've ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stops and looks at Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone flashy walks into your life and you're just gonna fall for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we married yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, uh, it doesn't work like that. There are other steps, it's complicated. They look at each other a beat and then walk on together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Oh! Georgia smiles at her, casually unnerving. Oliver pulls h away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home. CUT TO: Oliver and Georgia heading away through the galle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father? What will he possibly do without us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they're making their way out of the museum an formal o lady stops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia? You leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Mary, it's an emergency, Oliver's appendix has ruptured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear. They look at Oliver who's mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very composed child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Oliver pulls her away before she starts any more trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia's in drivers seat, they're at a stoplight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver points left and she turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha. The infamous left. Up a new street, they arrive at the next stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And? Oliver points left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left again. Going in circles. I like it. Irreverent but heavy, they drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Georgia enter. She heads down the hallway to h room, Young Oliver follows behind. She walks down the hal to her bedroom, enters and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver lies on his bed in the half darkness. He's been th a while, Arthur staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver remembers Anna on her hotel bed the night they met messing up his hair, kissing for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver feeling the most lost, can't help but look at Arth who's staring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We knew it wouldn't work even before we met her. Oliver get's this more than ever. Something changes insid him, he picks up his cel phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna? Where where you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver arrives with Arthur in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver hands Arthur, a dog bed, and a bag of dog food to Elliott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to take care of Elliott. I'll be back in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Thanks. Elliott closes the door. Oliver heads back to his car and Arthur's howling begins. It's an incredibly sad and despe howl. Oliver gets to his car, the howling doesn't stop, Oliver can't ignore it. Oliver get's out of the car, head back to house to get Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur drive up to a new house. Oliver looks a Arthur with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver watches Andy cry as Arthur licks him all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He remembers me. It's true, Oliver's surprised. 10/29/07 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy closes the door, Oliver walks the first ten feet, to surprise, silence. He walks to the edge of the yard, sile He tentatively gets into his car, silence. He drives away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver sees the Manhattan skyline as they cross the bridg into Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver crosses the cold New York avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver passes a bodega with flowers - he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver now with a bouquet of flowers in his hand, looking the right number, finds her building. On his way to the d he has doubts about the flowers, he decides to throw them away. Oliver rings her buzzer, no answers, a stranger leaves th building and he catches the door before it close, he ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver makes it to her door, he knocks, there's no answer pulls out his phone and calls her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Look I'm so sorry... But I'm, I'm at your front door. I'm in New York. Anna, still in bed, sits up and feels something.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm in Los Angeles. Oliver's flabbergasted she's not behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, you're in LA? Anna laughs, but is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were coming here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I didn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. I'm in your building. Anna laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay. See the window? Near the radiator? Oliver looks around and sees the radiator - goes to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a hide-a-key behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, Oliver tentatively enters the empty room. The apartment is very spare, barely lived in. A lone couc clothes on a rack, a few personal photos taped to the wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm inside. Wow, there's like nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Oliver moves forward into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is my kitchen. It's where I eat. Oliver follows her tour, while she's not there, it's strangely intimate.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is my bathroom. It's very fancy. The bare, poor bathroom is not fancy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Outside my window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver walks and looks out her window.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... That's my neighbor's roof. The room at the end is my bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver enters her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's my closet. Those are my clothes and my pictures. There is a single rack holding up some clothes. Her pictu are taped to the wall. Oliver sits on her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you leave everyone? Why did you let me go? Oliver thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPEAT MEMORY: Oliver watches his mother walk down the hallway, very alone, and enter her bedroom - it feels lik some gesture of hopelessness.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe because I, I don't really believe that it's gonna work. And then I make sure it doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal lies in the hospital bed set up in his living room. JUAN, a young handsome and probably gay hospice nurse is gently helping him take his morphine. Hal looks at Juan w love and affection. Oliver watches from the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't Juan's hair wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I use this great mousse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna try some? Hal turns shy and young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Just try a little bit. It'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm going to show you how. Juan steps away and grabs his mousse, puts a little in hi hand and sits back down on Hal's bed. He begins to spread it gently through wisps of Hal's white hair. Oliver watch Hal close his eyes, and deeply enjoy this simple affectio and camaraderie with another gay man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it? Hal looks into camera which is Oliver's POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look? Oliver's filled with love, happiness, regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's still on her bed, his heart and mind is somewher else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal's unconscious on his hospital bed. Some of Hal's frie gather around his hospital bed as Hal's gay priest gives his Last Rites - Oliver and Juan watch in disbelief in th background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver's alone in the kitchen, his head on the table - asleep. Juan walks to him and wakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver. He's gone. Oliver gets up. He can now see to the hospital bed, Hal's lifeless profile. Oliver is lost. Oliver goes to Hal, puts his head on his chest and cries.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once you make the call, you have less than an hour before two men come and place the body into a bag.

dialogues.speaker: OLVIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They charge 1485 Dollars for cremation and deliver the remains in a small metal container, the size of a jar of peanut butter. You will need to get a death certificate.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You will need to make copies and send them to cancel every credit card, phone account, utility, gym membership, every insurance policy, mortgage, to settle their taxes.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You will have all their mail forwarded to your address. You will write their obituary. You run it with a photo in the paper for two dollars a word. You will wonder if it's right. You'll throw a lot of their stuff away. You'll bring a lot of their stuff to your house. This is the photo my mother kept in her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I was a kid I thought that was my arm giving her daisies. Now I make a new mistake and think it's her arm giving me the daisies, saying, here, here's simple and happy. That's what I meant to give you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver arrives at Andy's door. Andy answers, Arthur's jum up to see Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... Oliver picks him up, he gets all of Arthur's stuff, he's little cold to Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cause I'm gay, isn't it? Oliver stops and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never called or came to see me? Oliver falters, not know how to say it, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, it's because my father loved you so much. This hits Andy hard. Oliver turns to leave but can't. He turns back, goes to Andy and they hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Arthur arrive, happy and relieved, Oliver jump his bed and Arthur follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... hey. Hey, how've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver opens the front door to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She's a bit tentative, but she's here and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in. Arthur runs up and Anna bends down to greet him. They mis each other. Anna walks in and Oliver follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room. She heads to the dinning room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dining room... Oliver laughs nervously. In the dining room, Hal's old bo are still stacked along the walls. Oliver leans forward a pulls something out of a box. She looks at a personal ad application, with the picture Hal in the open jean jacket we saw at the beginning of th film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Crazy picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for sex with the hope it turns into friendship or a relationship. But I don't insist on monogamy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see REPEAT SHOTS of Hal, and in every shot he's lookin camera. Hal telling Oliver he's gay, Hal napping with And and waving at Oliver, Hal after Juan put in his hair mous looking at Oliver, Hal showing Oliver his radiation tatoo

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm an old senior guy, 78, but I'm attractive and horny. I'm an art historian, now retired. MORE REPEAT SHOTS: Hal with Andy at the L.A. Pride picnic Hal playing with Arthur on his couch.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And in addition to art, I like houses, gardens, parties, and walking with my Jack Russell. I'm 5'11", 160 pounds. I'm trim, gray hair, blue eyes, hairy cheest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chest? I like giving and, and what? Oliver finishes reading for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like giving and getting rubdowns and then going into mutual soft stuff. They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a nice house with food, drinks, friends and me. If you are willing to try an older guy, let's meet and see what happens. She looks at the photo again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't give up. They look at each other, more vulnerable and willing than we've seen them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna walks down the hallway, Oliver follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Oliver sit side by side on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that work? They look at each other, they smile.
